private_information: You are in San Francisco for one day and want to meet as many friends as possible.
Meeting Joshua for at least 75 minutes is a priority.
You prefer to minimize unnecessary travel.
visitor.goal: Produce clear preferences and hard constraints for the day so a coordinator can find the best meet-up plan.

private_information: You can compile a symmetric travel-time graph from known locations.
You can validate and normalize travel times in minutes.
map_expert.goal: Provide accurate travel times between known locations as a compact graph.

private_information: You collect friends' availability windows and locations.
You ensure required minimum meeting durations are captured.
friend_coordinator.goal: List each friend's time windows and required minimums as structured data.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate constraints, travel times, and availabilities to produce the best schedule and the final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward.

public_information: You arrive at Union Square at 9:00 AM which is 540 minutes since midnight.
Joshua will be at Chinatown from 6:00 PM (1080) to 9:30 PM (1290).
You want to meet Joshua for a minimum of 75 minutes.
Travel time from Union Square to Chinatown is 7 minutes.
Travel time from Chinatown to Union Square is 7 minutes.
Consider different feasible schedules and pick the one that meets constraints and maximizes total friends met; currently, Joshua is the only specified friend.

preferences.system_prompt: You are the visitor. Summarize objective weights and hard constraints as compact JSON under <preferences> tags; include priorities such as meeting as many friends as possible, meeting Joshua for at least 75 minutes, and minimizing unnecessary travel.
preferences.prompt: Your name is visitor. Using the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->visitor->private_information}, produce a concise preferences object with fields: objective (maximize_meetings), hard_constraints (list), soft_preferences (list), and notes; wrap it under <preferences> and </preferences>.

routes.system_prompt: You are a mapping specialist. Provide a small travel-time graph in minutes under <graph> tags with nodes and directed edges.
routes.prompt: Your name is map_expert. Using the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->map_expert->private_information}, output a directed travel-time graph with nodes [Union_Square, Chinatown] and edges including both directions with 7-minute costs; wrap it under <graph> and </graph>.

availability.system_prompt: You coordinate friends' calendars. Emit availability windows as JSON under <windows> tags.
availability.prompt: Your name is friend_coordinator. From public information {environment->public_information} and your knowledge {agents->friend_coordinator->private_information}, produce windows for each friend with fields: name, location, start_min, end_min, min_meet_min; include an entry for Joshua at Chinatown from 1080 to 1290 with min_meet_min 75; wrap it under <windows> and </windows>.

synthesize_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent scheduling and PDDL targeting the FastDownward solver. Integrate inputs and produce a classical PDDL domain and problem; include only non-durative actions with numeric fluents for time and meeting progress. Enclose the domain between <domain> </domain> and the problem between <problem> </problem>.
synthesize_pddl.prompt: Integrate the visitor preferences {preferences_json}, the travel graph {travel_graph_json}, and the friend windows {friend_windows_json} together with public information {environment->public_information}. Produce a single consistent PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownward that models locations, the visitor position, a numeric function time in minutes since midnight, actions wait-1 that increase time by 1, travel between directed edges increasing time by the given minute cost, and meet-joshua-75 which requires being at Chinatown with time >= 1080 and time <= 1215 and sets met-joshua true while increasing time by 75; the initial state must place the visitor at Union_Square with time 540; the goal must include met-joshua true; add an optimization metric such as minimizing total time or total travel; avoid durative constructs and ensure names are simple and deterministic; output under the required tags.
